result.execSummary:
The defendant Wardel Burks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

**Restitution set at $0**
Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job; if defendant is in school part-time, defendant to have a full-time job

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses  or otherwise engage in drug dealing
No contact with Stephanie K.; T. Reid  who is the victim steaming from case 15CM1000

Cooperate with agent
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment on May 23, 2017.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest. Copies distributed to parties. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, calendar successor, for review. spc

Per Inter-Office communication received from the House of Correction:  Order for Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4) signed and filed.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge  Sanders  Br 28 for review. os

Defendant Wardel Burks in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Wardel Burks in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived constitutional rights and pled no contest and was examined as to his plea.  No contest plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by State, Defense and Defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 64 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 28 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 66 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 4 YEARS with the following conditions:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $0
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses  or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job; if defendant is in school part-time, defendant to have a full-time job 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-No contact with Stephanie K.; T. Reid  who is the victim steaming from case 15CM1000
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-As a condition of probation, Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 year in House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for the day reporting center, treatment, assessment and vocational training.  No electronic monitoring 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit form
All other previously set conditions of bail remain the same.
Bail motion by defense. Arguments heard.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Wardel Burks not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date. Court will accept case #15CM1000 as a part of a global resolution. Case remains calendared in Branch 21.

Defendant Wardel Burks in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Wardel Burks in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Wardel Burks not in court, defendant in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Jude did not appear or contact the Court.  State did have witness(s) present.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Stephanie K;  Scooters Pub's - 154 E Juneau, Milwaukee
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Wardel Burks in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  
Defendant Wardel Burks in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
